SEARCH
Package ygong.APS

Class Schedule.Grade

java.lang.Object
ygong.APS.Schedule.Grade
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<Schedule.Grade>
Enclosing class:
Schedule
public static class Schedule.Grade extends Object implements Comparable<Schedule.Grade>
Helper class for calculating the grade of the schedule

The class that contains the grade of the schedule, which is calculated based on the on-time percentage, makespan percentage, earliest start time percentage, and latest due time percentage.

The grade is used to compare schedules and determine the best schedule.

See Also:

  • Field Details

    • on_time_percentage

      protected final double on_time_percentage
      percentage of on-time orders

    • makespan_percentage

      protected final double makespan_percentage
      2-% to the best makespan schedule

      e.g. if the best makespan is 100, and the current schedule makespan is 110 the makespan_percentage is equal to 2 - 110/100 = 0.9.
      This makes sure the best makespan is getting 100% on this percentage and other longer ones get lower

      See Also:
      • Schedule.calcStat(double, int)
      Note:
      this percentage can be negative if the makespan is over twice the best makespan

    • est_percentage

      protected final double est_percentage
      The percentage of schedules that does not violate the earliest start time.

      e.g. if we have 3 orders vialate the earliest starting time, and we have 20 orders total. We will have 17/20 = 0.85 on est_percentage.
      This make sure the best schedule get 100% on this percentage and other schedules get lower.

      See Also:
      • Schedule.calcStat(double, int)

    • ldt_percentage

      protected final double ldt_percentage
      The percentage of schedules that does not violate the latest due time.

      e.g. if we have 3 orders vialate the latest due time, and we have 20 orders total. We will have 17/20 = 0.85 on ldt_percentage.
      This make sure the best schedule get 100% on this percentage and other schedules get lower.

      See Also:
      • Schedule.calcStat(double, int)

    • grade

      private double grade
      The final grade for the schedule
      See Also:
      • Schedule.calcGradeByWeights(int, int, int, int)
